reviewText: This is a great dvd for really little girls - This dvd will never teach anyone to be the next Anna Pavlova, but it did provide exactly what you would expect it to for home ballet lessons that will hold the attention of little ones under 5 years of age - And the true critic, my 2 year old great granddaughter, Well, She Loves It...

reviewText: I bought this DVD for my granddaughter who is 6 years old.  She loves it, and it helps her with her ballet positions.

reviewText: The description says that it is fun. It is the opposite of fun! Very boring for adults and children. Also, like another reviewer said, it's very much like a home video. I'm really stuck trying to find a video for my twin girls that is fun, educational and appealing. There are plenty to choose from, I just don't know which one :(

reviewText: My daughter enjoys learning the ballet moves. She chooses it over kids yoga most of the time. It's very easy for her to follow and learn the moves.
Title: N/A

reviewText: My 2.5 y/o daughter loves to dance around the house and is a very bright little thing.  She loves to dance to Dancing with the Stars, so I thought this DVD would be perfect for her.  Well, unless I really get up and do it with her and do lots of coaxing, she's totally bored.  The instructor on this DVD has absolutely no personality.  I realize these are ballet drills, but come on, lighten up a little, these are kids.  This would probably be better for a kid who is already in a ballet class and needs practice at home.  But just for the fun of doing ballet, I would look for something else.  I got her one the Yoga Kids dvd, and the instructor makes it fun, so my daughter runs over to the tv to do the yoga very excitedly.  I think when you made a dvd for kids, especially one called "Baby Ballet," there should be some effort to actually engage them.  This ballet video is a major yawn.
summary: Very dry to watch for toddler

reviewText: Although they were inspirational for little dancers, the lessons just weren't that long.  Still, we do recommend Baby Ballet to future ballerina's.
